t: When*pn Israel came out of Egypt — the*ln house of Jacob from a people who*ln spoke a foreign language—
Judah*ln became his sanctuary, Israel,*ln his dominion.
The*pn sea looked and fled; the*ln Jordan turned back.
The*ln mountains skipped like rams, the*ln hills, like lambs.
Why*ln was it, sea, that you fled? Jordan,*ln that you turned back?
Mountains,*ln that you skipped like rams? Hills,*ln like lambs?
Tremble,*pn earth, at the presence of the Lord, at*ln the presence of the God of Jacob,
who*ln turned the rock into a pool, the*ln flint into a spring.
